intro: Euphrasia praecurta, commonly known as the short-stemmed eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Euphrasia praecurta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its common name reflects the shape of its flowers, which resemble tiny eyes.
